channel.title: Data Science Portfolio on Guillaume Paviot
channel.description: Recent content in Data Science Portfolio on Guillaume Paviot

item.title: A poem generator
item.description: The goal of this project is to implement at low levels different NLP algorithms and neural nets in PyTorch to learn more about them. I train those algorithms on Les Fleurs du Mal written by French poet Charles Baudelaire. Current language model neural nets implemented: Bigram (with one, two character or one word as input) Bag of Words MLP, along the lines of Bengio et al. 2003 (with both characters or word as input) Link to GitHub Repository

item.title: Ranking a video game's players
item.description: At the end of every year, the best League of Legend teams from all regions gather on one server to train before the World Championships. And this is the best time to scrape data from the API to answer the question: who is the strongest player ? Who is the strongest team ? I will reuse the code I used last year to scrape data and then explore the dataset with some visualisation.

item.title: A network of Twitter accounts
item.description: The goal of this project was to learn more about networks and use the Twitter API. During a trending topic on Twitter and Twitch involving a lot of reactions from different communities, I scrapped almost 29 000 tweets from the API. To be used in Gephi, I had to clean the data and scrape the missing values from other endpoints. Then, I separated the cleaned data into an edges CSV file and a nodes CSV file.

item.title: Forecasting electric consumption
item.description: With this project, I wanted to learn about time series and how to forecast them. For the data, I downloaded a JSON file from ENEDIS open data, the french electrical distributor, which reprensents the volumes of energy injected, extracted, produced or consumed in the Enedis mesh over a period of time given to the step of half an hour. From all the features, I only kept the timestamp and total consumption.

item.title: A chatbot talking about plastic
item.description: This group project was an academic project for the NGO The Sea Cleaners. The goal was to develop a chatbot to make their FAQ more attractive. The requirements were : the chatbot could be integrated in a website the chatbot is interactive the code is readable and the bot is easy to use for non coder We choose to use Tensorflow to analyse the question and find and answer, and integrate it in Flask.

item.title: Contact
item.description: You can follow me on these social media platforms. Platform URL Twitter: https://twitter.com/Guillaume_Pvt LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/guillaume-paviot/ Kaggle: https://www.kaggle.com/guillaumepvt GitHub: https://github.com/guillaumepaviot
